result.execSummary:
The defendant Susan J Bradley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs on Ct. 1.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

To pay the costs of the action on Ct. 2.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. No contact with the victim.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.  Take medications as prescribed.

timeConds.notes: Jail time applies to Ct. 1. Stayed - to be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. If stay is lifted, huber release is granted.
To perform 20 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Huber release and good time granted. Credit for time served.
$100 fine plus costs. 60 days to pay fine/costs or set up payment plan with the Clerk of Courts office.

records.addlTxt: Door County Jail Request for Sentence Modification - defendant requests 1 to 1-1/2 week furlough to take care of personal business. Court denies request.

Defendant Susan J Bradley in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Defendant Susan J Bradley in custody.  Joan Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. State makes sentencing recommendation. Defense gives sentencing argument. Defendant makes statement to the court. Court makes statement, imposes sentence.
from Atty Reetz re: sentencing after revocation hearing date.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 10, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Susan J Bradley in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State amends Ct. 1 to Misd. Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to amended Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 as charged. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of amended Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 as charged. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation.  Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Defendant's

Defendant Susan J Bradley in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, indicates matter is in the #1 position for trial. Defense indicates matter is still proceeding to trial. Court needs to know by noon on Friday 8/14/15 if matter resolves.  Bond remains in effect.
Jury trial at 08-19-2015 08:30 am
Pre-trial conference at 08-03-2015 08:30 am
to Adjourn Trial granted
to Adjourn Trial by the State
from Atty Reetz advising that defendant now desires a trial in this matter. Court sets pretrial and trial.
Jury trial at 07-01-2015 08:30 am
Pre-trial conference at 06-15-2015 11:00 am

Defendant Susan J Bradley in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz asks court to set a plea/sentencing hearing in 2 - 3 weeks. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Susan J Bradley in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Defendant Susan J Bradley in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews competency report from Dr. Galli. Court questions defendant whether she's competent to proceed. Defendant feels she is competent to proceed. State relying on Dr. Galli's report. Court finds defendant competent to proceed in this matter. Atty Reetz asks court to set a status in April. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 09:45 am.
from Atty Reetz asking to reschedule 3/20/15 competency hearing because of a conflict. Court reschedules.
Competency hearing at 03-23-2015 01:45 pm
from defendant requesting another attorney be appointed to her case.

Defendant Susan J Bradley in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews letter from defendant requesting a new attorney. Atty Richards provides court with another letter from defendant requesting new counsel. Atty Richards moves to withdraw from the case. Court grants motion. Defendant to contact PD's office to have new counsel appointed. Atty Richards will also advise PD that new counsel needs to be appointed. Bond remains in effect.  Competency hearing scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 09:30 am.
from defendant advising she would like to dismiss her attorney, Steve Richards.
Competency evaluation done by Dr. Galli.
by DHS

Defendant Susan J Bradley in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Susan J Bradley in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Richards is questioning defendants competency to aide in her defense in this matter, asks court to order a competency evaluation. Court orders competency evaluation.  Bond remains in effect.  Competency hearing scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 08:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 1/09/15 by jail staff.  (fingerprint card destroyed 8/27/15)

Defendant Susan J Bradley in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.   Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains as is.  Status conference scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 10:30 am.
State's Discovery Demand

Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover. State doesn't have an Information ready, will file it by the end of the day today showing the same charges and max. penalties. Court sets Arraignment. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Susan J Bradley in court with attorney Steven G. Richards who appears by phone.  Defendant Susan J Bradley in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defense waives reading of the complaint, advises defendant wishes to waive her right to a preliminary hearing today.  Arraignment scheduled for January 15, 2015 at 10:45 am.
Defense Discovery Demand
Adjourned initial appearance on January 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No contact direct or indirect with A.H. or her residence.   To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Susan J Bradley in court, in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defendant indicates Attorney Steve Richards will be representing her, thought he was going to be in court with her this morning.   Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
